results.title: 70mm cement splicer
results.brief_description:
70mm cement splicer
Richard Brown donation
Made from cast iron and the paint is noticeably flaking off. There is still film in the splicer. There is still a piece of blank film inside it.

results.title: Economic Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
Through the sequences in “Economic Australia” students have a rare opportunity to turn back the clock to witness filmmakers’ views of Australia’s economic development. The content focuses on some major events in the economic history of the nation as well as those everyday situations in which economics plays a part in our lives. Presented by Annette Shun Wah.

results.title: Women in change
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
A history of Australia’s women looking specifically at: the suffragette movement; the campaign for equal pay; women and unionism; abortion; contraception, sexual harassment; and politics.

results.title: Editing
results.creator_credit: Bruce A. Block, Tim Barr and AIMS Instructional Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Discusses the processes of film editing from the preparation of the work print to the completion of a finished, edited film. Explains the processes of setting up the editing bench, rewinding, using the moviescope, splicing, breaking-down the work print, marking, adding dialogue and using the moviola.

results.title: Arts in society
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
A program in which archival footage has been selected to provide students with some background on the influence of the arts in Australians’ lives.

results.title: Stunts: fights and falls
results.creator_credit: Tony De Zarraga and Tim Barr
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Like good athletes, stuntmen must warm up before attempting any feats. Control and practice are of paramount importance. For realism rehearsal in the front of a camera and the matching of the movements of the actor and stuntman are essential. The narrator Jack Mohoney, as well as giving the historical background to stunts in films gives many hints on safety and training.

results.title: Film Australia's Australia
results.brief_description: The series deals with changes in the physical, social, cultural, political and economic spheres of Australian life. Utilises materials dating back from the beginnings of filmmaking in this country in the early 1900s.
results.description: The series deals with changes in the physical, social, cultural, political and economic spheres of Australian life. Utilises materials dating back from the beginnings of filmmaking in this country in the early 1900s.

results.title: Black Australia (A)
results.creator_credit: Darrell Sibosado, Michael Brogan and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
Film and video segments relevant to this topic have been selected with original footage accompanied by original soundtracks. This program represents aspects of Aboriginal culture in Australia, and focuses on Aboriginal identity. The program uses the unifying symbols found in what is now known as the Aboriginal flag. The three colours in the flag symbolise the Aboriginal way of perceiving: red (land and politics), black (identity and self determination), and yellow (art and spirituality). These three interlinked themes are explored in the film with a focus on stimulating deeper understanding by white Australia on Aboriginality, the attitudes of white Australians towards Aboriginal people, racism in Australia, both individual and institutional and the changes needed in attitude and action to achieve justice. Teacher’s Guide included. Presented by Annette Shun Wah. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Lighting on location
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Larry Boehlins, an experienced “gaffer” covers key points such as: sources of power, hook up, the use of filters on lights and cameras, polaroid filters, window diffusion, use of reflectors etc. The film introduces a variety of grip equipment.
